title: Web-Based Constructivist Mathematics Learning Design: Application of Mobile Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience with web-based tools
context.additional_context: An environment where current secondary mathematics practitioners learn flexibly in time and place using personal devices, emphasizing learner-led knowledge construction through constructivist approaches

learning_goals: Learners can explain the interconnectedness of mathematical concepts by 80% or more using hyperlink features on the WBL platform
Learners design solutions for real-world problems three or more times through constructivist activities (discussions, case analyses) in mobile environments
Learners can self-diagnose their learning progress weekly in five or more categories through formative assessments (quizzes, peer reviews)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
